result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas E Bland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to serve 3 days Jail consecutive in lieu of costs.  Sentence credit 3 days.  TIME SERVED.
Straight time.  Sentence credit for 15 days were granted.  TIME SERVED.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Nicholas E Bland in court with attorney Nicole M Masnica.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Masnica makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 
The Court Orders the Following:
Sentence of:  Ct #1. 
15 Days Jail (Credit - 15 days). TIME SERVED.
COSTS:  $243.00, in leiu of costs, defendant to serve 3 days consecutive.  Credit 3 days.  TIME SERVED.
Sentencing hearing at 01-04-2016 03:00 pm
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Nicholas E Bland in court with attorney Nicole M Masnica.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appeared very early for court.  Amended information filed in Court.  Charge amended to a misdemeanor.  Defendant plead no contest to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of the amended count #1.  Court schedules this matter for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
